revised_title: Ancient Tessellated Mosaic Work at Leicester
tldr: The author, Samuel Carte, describes an ancient tessellated mosaic work discovered in a cellar in Leicester. The mosaic depicts the fable of a person who offended Venus, leading her to make her son Cupid make the person fall in love with a monster. The mosaic is surrounded by two lists and a wreath of various colors, with a total area of one yard by one yard. The author hopes that this description will give a clear idea of the historical monument.
